func.title: Electronic Switches and Dimmers with Local Control

case.title: CMD 0x1 - Actuator Set Output
case.description:
This message is sent to an actuator. It controls switching / dimming of one or all channels of an actuator.
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_01.png
REMARK:
In case an Actuator Set Output message specifies a parameter that is not supported by the addressed device, such device should react as following:
- Channel not supported by device -> ignore message
- Dimming command to switching device -> no change of status
- Dimming command with non-supported speed -> dim with regular speed
RECOMMENDATION:
Dimmers should take things like phase shifting into account to provide dimming based on power consumption (results in brightness for lamps) rather than interpreting percentage values as phase angle only.

item.description: Dim to new output value – dim timer 1
Dim to new output value – dim timer 2
Dim to new output value – dim timer 3
All output channels supported by the device
Output value not valid / not applicable

case.title: CMD 0x2 - Actuator Set Local
case.description:
This message is sent to an actuator. It configures one or all channels of an actuator.
Response Timing: None
RECOMMENDATION:
In case the device implements an internal order for dim timers, this order should be from “dim timer 1” (fast) to “dim timer 3” (slow). The configured time shall always be interpreted for a full range (0 to 100%) dimming.
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_02.png

item.description: Over current shut down: static off
Over current shut down: automatic restart
Reset over current shut down: not active
Reset over current shut down: trigger signal
All output channels supported by the device

case.title: CMD 0x3 - Actuator Status Query
case.description:
This message is sent to an actuator. It requests the status of one or all channels of an actuator.
Response Timing:
An Actuator Status Response message shall be received within a maximum of 300ms from the time of transmission of this message. In case no such response is received within this time frame the action shall be treated as completed without result.
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_03.png

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

case.title: CMD 0x4 - Actuator Status Response
case.description:
This message is sent by an actuator if one of the following events occurs:
- Status of one channel has been changed locally
- Message Actuator Status Query has been received
Response Timing:
This message shall be sent within a maximum of 50ms from the time of reception of the Actuator Status Query message.
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_04.png
REMARK 1:
In case an Actuator Status Query message specifies a parameter that is not supported by the device being addresses, such device shall ignore the message and shall not answer using the Actuator Status Response message.
REMARK 2:
In case an Actuator Status Query message queries all output channels supported by a device being addresses, such device shall answer per each output channel by using an individual Actuator Measurement Response message.

item.description: Over current switch off: ready / not supported
output value not valid / not set

case.title: CMD 0x5 - Actuator Set Measurement
case.description:
The command defines values at offset 32 and at offset 40 which are the limits for the transmission periodicity of messages. MIT must not be set to 0, MAT >= MIT.
Response Timing: None
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_05.png

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

datafield.data: Maximum time between two subsequent actuator messages
Minimum time between two subsequent actuator messages

case.title: CMD 0x6 - Actuator Measurement Query
case.description:
This message is sent to an actuator. The actuator replies with an Actuator Measurement Response message.
Response Timing:
An Actuator Message Response message shall be received within a maximum of 300ms from the time of transmission of this message. In case no such response is received within this time frame the action shall be treated as completed without result.
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_06.png

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

case.title: CMD 0x7 - Actuator Measurement Response
case.description:
This message is sent by an actuator if one of the following events occurs:
- Measurement results trigger an automated transmission (see Actuator Set Measurement message)
- Message Actuator Measurement Query has been received
Response Timing:
This message shall be sent within a maximum of 50ms from the time of reception of the Actuator Measurement Query message.
graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_07.png
REMARK 1:
In case an Actuator Measurement Query message specifies a parameter that is not supported by the device addressed, such device shall ignore the message and shall not answer using the Actuator Measurement Response message.
REMARK 2:
In case an Actuator Measurement Query message queries all output channels supported by a device being addresses, such device shall answer per each output channel by using an individual Actuator Measurement Response message.

case.title: CMD 0x8 - Actuator Set Pilot Wire Mode
CMD 0x9 - Actuator Pilot Wire Mode Query
CMD 0xA - Actuator Pilot Wire Mode Response
CMD 0xB - Actuator Set External Interface Settings

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

Delay timer before setting output channel to OFF value received by radio cmd

item.description: Change of key state sets ON or OFF

Specific ON/OFF positions.
ON when contacts are closed.
OFF when contacts are open.

case.title: CMD 0xC - Actuator External Interface Settings Query

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

case.title: CMD 0xD - Actuator External Interface Settings Response

datafield.description: Timer to automatically set OFF output channel when it is set ON
Delay timer before setting output channel to OFF value received by radio cmd

item.description: Change of key state sets ON or OFF

Specific ON/OFF positions.
ON when contacts are closed.
OFF when contacts are open.

case.title: CMD 0xF / ECID 0x00 - Actuator Set Dimming Limits
case.description:
This message is sent to the actuator. It controls the maximum and minimum brightness of the channel output. If the actuator receives an out of range dimming value or an error command, the following actions should be performed:
Channel not supported by device -> ignore the message
Set dimming minimum value is less than 0% -> The minimum value is set to 0%
Set dimming maximum value greater than 100% -> The maximum value is set to 100% graphics/EEP_D2-01-xx_CMD_0F_ECID_00.png

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

case.title: CMD 0xF / ECID 0x01 - Actuator Dimming Limits Query

item.description: All output channels supported by the device

case.title: CMD 0xF / ECID 0x02 - Actuator Dimming Limits Response

item.description: All output channels supported by the device
